name: Bunch's Crab Casserole
author: Frances S.
summary: This is my grandmother's recipe - 'Bunch' is short for 'Honeybunch,' our pet name for her.  It is always a huge hit and it can be constructed the night before if need be. Just allow a little extra cooking time since the dish will be cold from refrigeration.
ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) package herb-seasoned dry bread stuffing mix
directions: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water
Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat
Cover and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes
Remove from hot water, cool, peel and chop
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
Lightly grease an 11x7 inch baking dish
In a bowl, combine the chopped eggs, heavy cream, mayonnaise, onion, parsley, and sherry
Reserve 1/2 cup of the stuffing mix and add the rest to the egg mixture
Pour the mixture into prepared baking dish and sprinkle the reserved stuffing on top
Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes or until bubbly and slightly browned on top
